title: minerjones
author: minerjones
content: Mixed lot of random crypto items:-Tiffany & Co. 1837 Money Clip in 925 Sterling Silver with BTC silver coin attached*Coin tests at 999, Money clip tests at just below 925...more around 900*-2019 SF Blockchain Bitcoin Coin non-silver version-Cryptofreeze V2.S2 blue coin w/ COA (made by bitguy101)-Ballet Pure Bitcoin wallet cards: 1x 1000 bits / 3x 100 bitsSTARTING BID: 0.0000BTCMINIMUM BID INCREMENT: 0.0001BTC**Please limit bids to ONLY 4 decimal places**END TIME: MAY 16th, 2022, 14:00:00 PDT**Payment due within 24 hours of auction end!!**SNIPE: Any bid made in last 5 minutes will extend the auction 5 minutes beyond the ending time.If within those 5 extended minutes, a new bid is made, 5 minutes will be added to the auction from the time of that bid.PAYMENT: Bitcoin BTC. A signed PGP message will be sent to winner with payment addressSHIPPING: Based on location and preference

comments.author: Cryptogreatdane
comments.body: Did someone attach that coin to the money clip? I assume tiffany didn't produce it that way. If so how is it attached to the clip?

comments.author: minerjones
comments.body: Quote from: MoparMiningLLC on May 13, 2022, 03:50:20 PM.007BTCCurrent high bidQuote from: Cryptogreatdane on May 13, 2022, 05:25:17 PMDid someone attach that coin to the money clip? I assume tiffany didn't produce it that way. If so how is it attached to the clip?Yes Here is the coin they used: https://www.goldenstatemint.com/1-oz-Bitcoin-Silver-Bullion-Round.htmlFor some reason, it also seems like the coin was plated to make it look like the clip (more matte) and not the usual shiny surface.And correct, this was done 2nd-hand by whomever made this.Was obtained in a larger lot of items that was part of a trade I made.I am guessing some sort of strong epoxy/glue... doesn't appear to be welded or anything like that.
